titleStmt.title: Despatch from Bailey & Alexander to Thomas B. Florence, January 31, 1859

bibl.title: Despatch from Bailey & Alexander to Thomas B. Florence, January 31, 1859
Despatches from United States Consuls in Sierra Leone, 1858-1906 T-438

div1.p:
To Honl Thomas B. Florence
H. R.

We have instructed to our several copies of Certificates, also an Original petition from Ship masters for the appointment of John E. Taylor as consul at Sierra Leone on the Coast of Africa, Mr Taylor was appointed by Commodore Mayo commander of the United States Squadron in the year as you will perceive by enclosed Copies of Certificates to you, object in writing is to have the appointment of John E. Taylor by Commodore Mayo, confirmed by the President of the United States and by the Senate if neccessary or in any manner that is legal and right to have the said appointment confirmed, your attention to this will place us under another obligation to you were we already owe you so much, Please let us hear from you at your earliest convenience, we know how much your valuable time is taken up but still take the liberty of addressing you on this subject.

Very Respectfully,
yrs
Bailey & Alexander
No 402 Library Street
Papers enclosed we requested to take great as there are no Copies
div1.ab:
Respectfully refer to the consideration of the Secretary of the State, by Thomas B. Florence
H of R
